meanings.definition: A straight line from the center to the circumference of a circle or sphere, dividing it into two equal parts.
meanings.sent1: The semidiameter of the circle was easy to measure because it split the shape perfectly in half.
meanings.sent2: The semidiameter of the sphere was crucial for calculating its volume.
meanings.sent3: The semidiameter of the pizza was so precise that each slice had an equal amount of toppings.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the semidiameter of a sun, radiating warmth and joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The semidiameter of the clock face pointed directly at six, indicating it was time to go home.

meanings.definition: Half the diameter of a circle or sphere.
meanings.sent1: The semidiameter of the circle was half the length of its full diameter.
meanings.sent2: Calculating the semidiameter of the sphere helped in determining its surface area.
meanings.sent3: The semidiameter of the watermelon was so large that it looked like a giant ball.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed through the room, reaching every corner like the semidiameter of a sound wave.
meanings.sent5: The semidiameter of the tree trunk was so wide that it took two people to wrap their arms around it.
